1.Pros: Decent money if you're a teen
1.Cons: Disrespectful customers. Gave me the runarounds when I first applied.

2.Pros: Benefits and free food/discounts, easy, good for starters, manageable, fun, pleasant, good experience, decent starting hourly pay.

3.Cons: A lot of standing up work jobl

4.Pros: Very friendly and helpful co'workers team work oriented. Managers at the franchise I worked at on my shift were very considerate and appreciated their workers.
4.Cons: During the time that I was working at the East North Ave. franchise management was about to change and the business was in total chaos financially. Our checks were bouncing and now their under a totally new management team with new owners.

5.Pros: Good first job as a teenager or young adult. Expands your social skills and learns to deal with finicky people.
5.Cons: Managers and other employees are often mean and degrading. No good incentive programs.

6.Summary: "Shift MAnager-Easy work with decent pay if you can handle people"
6.Pros: Pay is actually decent at the manager level with none of the work being to difficult or nasty. Also extremely flexible hours is very nice.
6.Cons: you will have to put up with some far less than stellar quality people both as crew and customers. Cussing is common from angry customers.

7.Pros: Easy interviewi can't think go anything else good to say

8.Pros: The employees were great and I learned a lot in managing a staff of 8 or more employees.
8.Cons: The pay wasn't good and was treated poorly by corporate.

9.Pros: Be able to work my best and gain money
